title: Copying my local Win7 installation to a USB HDD

forumNotes.author: blah
forumNotes.content: Would it be possible to copy my current Windows 7 installation (on present on my internal HDD) to an external drive and boot off it ?

forumNotes.author: karyonix
forumNotes.content:
Copy it as is ... No  
With some preparation ... Yes  

First, read the sticky threads here [http://www.boot-land...hp?showforum=77](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showforum=77 "External link") .  
If you don't understand something, post your question here.

forumNotes.author: erwan.l
forumNotes.content:
Hi Blah,  

When lucky, porting windows7 to a USB-HDD is pretty straight forward :  

-"byte to byte" clone your source drive to your target usb-hdd  
-patch the offline registry by deleting mounteddevices key  
-patch the offline registry by starting USB drivers  

At next reboot on your usb-hdd, windows7 should start.  

At least, it is the way it works for me ![:whistling:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/happy22.gif)  

Regards,  
Erwan.
